page.title: 19Newburgh in the Future
page.content: There is a old factory in Newburgh on the shores of the River Tay which made linoleum until 1979 when it was burned down. It has lain empty since then and now looks very ugly against the lovely surrounding countryside. The council are thinking about making a harbour and a housing scheme as it is next to the River Tay. This will enable more people to get houses easier in the future. If I had the choice I would make it into a sports centre. If it was made into a sports centre there would be more people visiting Newburgh that would normally come. I would like to see a swimming pool, a yachting centre, squash and tennis courts, and perhaps even a golf course. All these things would help to attract more visitors to my town.
